sync_changes.label: Sync Changes to Profiles
sync_changes.tooltip: Sync changes made to all profiles.

reset_to_default.tooltip: Reset Current Tab Settings to default values.

key_settings.title: Key Settings
key_settings.description: A simplified configuration interface for quick setup.

key_settings.label: Key Settings
key_settings.tooltip: These are the most important settings for quick setup. All of these settings are duplicated from other tabs.

vad_enabled.label: VAD Enabled:
vad_enabled.tooltip: Enable or disable Voice Activity Detection (VAD) processing.

websocket_enabled.label: Websocket Enabled:
websocket_enabled.tooltip: Enable or disable WebSocket communication. Enabling this will disable the clipboard monitor.

allow_both_simultaneously.label: Allow Both Simultaneously:
allow_both_simultaneously.tooltip: Enable to allow GSM to accept both clipboard and websocket input at the same time.

merge_sequential_text.label: Merge Matching Sequential Text:
merge_sequential_text.tooltip: Enable to merge matching sequential text into a single entry. Designed for Luna's Speech Recognition feature. Very niche.

websocket_uri.label: Websocket URI(s):
websocket_uri.tooltip: WebSocket URI for connecting. Allows Comma Separated Values for Connecting Multiple.

texthook_regex.label: TextHook Replacement Regex:
texthook_regex.tooltip: Regex to run replacement on texthook input, set this to the same as what you may have in your texthook page.

open_config_on_startup.label: Open Config on Startup:
open_config_on_startup.tooltip: Whether to open config when the script starts.

open_texthooker_on_startup.label: Open GSM Texthooker on Startup:
open_texthooker_on_startup.tooltip: Whether to open Texthooking page when the script starts.

texthooker_port.label: GSM Texthooker Port:
texthooker_port.tooltip: Port for the Texthooker to run on. Only change if you know what you are doing.

current_version.label: Current Version:
current_version.tooltip: The current version of the application.

latest_version.label: Latest Version:
latest_version.tooltip: The latest available version of the application.

native_language.label: Native Language:
native_language.tooltip: Select your native language. This is used for various features, but will not change the look of GSM.

legend.advanced: Highlights Advanced Features that may break things.
legend.recommended: Indicates Recommended, but completely optional settings.
legend.tooltip_info: Every Label in settings has a tooltip with more information if you hover over them.

locale.label: Language:
locale.tooltip: Select the application's language. This will change the interface language.

folder_to_watch.label: OBS Replay Path:
folder_to_watch.tooltip: Path where the OBS Replays will be saved. This should be configured for you.

output_folder.label: Output Mirror Folder:
output_folder.tooltip: Path where all exported files (screenshots, audio, etc.) will be saved in addition to Anki. Useful for accessing files outside of Anki. (Optional)

copy_temp_files_to_output_folder.label: Enabled:
copy_temp_files_to_output_folder.tooltip: Whether to copy temporary files to the output folder.

open_output_folder_on_card_creation.label: Open Output Folder on Card Creation:
open_output_folder_on_card_creation.tooltip: Open the output folder when a card is created. Useful for quick access to files.

copy_trimmed_replay_to_output_folder.label: Copy Trimmed Replay to Output Folder:
copy_trimmed_replay_to_output_folder.tooltip: Copy a loosely trimmed replay to the output folder.

remove_video.label: Remove Replay:
remove_video.tooltip: Remove replay from the OBS output folder.

remove_audio.label: Remove Audio from Folder:
remove_audio.tooltip: Remove audio from the output. This does not affect Anki, only the audio destination folder.

remove_screenshot.label: Remove Screenshot from Folder:
remove_screenshot.tooltip: Remove screenshots from the screenshot destination folder. This does not affect Anki, only the screenshot destination folder.

update_anki.label: Update Anki:
update_anki.tooltip: Automatically update Anki with new data.

show_update_confirmation_dialog.label: Show Update Confirmation Dialog:
show_update_confirmation_dialog.tooltip: Show a confirmation dialog before updating Anki cards.

url.label: Anki URL:
url.tooltip: The URL to connect to your Anki instance.

sentence_field.label: Sentence Field:
sentence_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for the main sentence.

sentence_audio_field.label: Sentence Audio Field:
sentence_audio_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for audio associated with the sentence. Leave Blank to Disable Audio Processing.

picture_field.label: Picture Field:
picture_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for associated pictures.

word_field.label: Word Field:
word_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for individual words.

previous_sentence_field.label: Previous Sentence Field:
previous_sentence_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for the previous line of dialogue. If Empty, will not populate

previous_image_field.label: Previous VoiceLine SS Field:
previous_image_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for the screenshot of previous line. If Empty, will not populate

video_field.label: Video Field:
video_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for associated videos. This will be AV1 encoded video of the VAD Trimmed Voiceline, if no Voice found, this will be empty. (OPTIONAL)

custom_tags.label: Add Tags:
custom_tags.tooltip: Comma-separated custom tags for the Anki cards.

game_name_field.label: Game Name Field:
game_name_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for the game name. If empty, game name will not be added as a field. (OPTIONAL)

tags_to_check.label: Tags to work on:
tags_to_check.tooltip: Comma-separated Tags, script will only do 1-click on cards with these tags (Recommend keep empty, or use Yomitan Profile to add custom tag from texthooker page)

add_game_tag.label: Add Game as Tag:
add_game_tag.tooltip: Include a tag for the game on the Anki card.

parent_tag.label: Game Parent Tag:
parent_tag.tooltip: Parent tag for the Game Tag. If empty, no parent tag will be added. i.e. Game::{Game_Title}. You can think of this as a "Folder" for your tags

overwrite_audio.label: Overwrite Audio:
overwrite_audio.tooltip: Overwrite existing audio in Anki cards.

overwrite_picture.label: Overwrite Picture:
overwrite_picture.tooltip: Overwrite existing pictures in Anki cards.

multi_overwrites_sentence.label: Multi-line Mining Overwrite Sentence:
multi_overwrites_sentence.tooltip: When using Multi-line Mining, overwrite the sentence with a concatenation of the lines selected.

do_postprocessing.label: Voice Detection Postprocessing:
do_postprocessing.tooltip: Enable post-processing of audio to trim just the voiceline.

language.label: Language:
language.tooltip: Select the language for VAD. This is used for Whisper Only.

whisper_model.label: Whisper Model:
whisper_model.tooltip: Select the Whisper model size for VAD.

selected_model.label: Select VAD Model:
selected_model.tooltip: Select which VAD model to use.

backup_model.label: Backup VAD Model:
backup_model.tooltip: Select which model to use as a backup if no audio is found.

add_on_no_results.label: Add Audio on No Results:
add_on_no_results.tooltip: Add audio even if no results are found by VAD.

audio_end_offset.label: Audio End Offset:
audio_end_offset.tooltip: Offset in seconds from end of the video to extract.

trim_beginning.label: Trim Beginning:
trim_beginning.tooltip: Beginning offset after VAD Trim, Only active if "Trim Beginning" is ON. Negative values = more time at the beginning

beginning_offset.label: Beginning Offset:
beginning_offset.tooltip: Beginning offset after VAD Trim, Only active if "Trim Beginning" is ON. Negative values = more time at the beginning

cut_and_splice.label: Cut and Splice Voice Segments:
cut_and_splice.tooltip: Cut Detected Voice Segments and Paste them back together. More Padding = More Space between voicelines.

splice_padding.label: Padding:
splice_padding.tooltip: Cut Detected Voice Segments and Paste them back together. More Padding = More Space between voicelines.

use_cpu_for_inference.label: Force CPU:
use_cpu_for_inference.tooltip: Even if CUDA is installed, use CPU for Whisper

use_tts_as_fallback.label: Use TTS as Fallback:
use_tts_as_fallback.tooltip: Use Text-to-Speech as a fallback when no audio is found.

tts_url.label: TTS URL:
tts_url.tooltip: URL for the Text-to-Speech service. Use $s as a placeholder for the text.

notify_on_update.label: Notify on Update:
notify_on_update.tooltip: Notify the user when an update occurs.

open_anki_edit.label: Open Anki Note in Edit View:
open_anki_edit.tooltip: Automatically open Anki for editing after updating.

open_anki_browser.label: Open Anki Note in Browser View:
open_anki_browser.tooltip: Open Anki note in browser after updating.

browser_query.label: Browser Query:
browser_query.tooltip: Query to use when opening Anki notes in the browser. Ex: 'Added:1'

backfill_audio.label: Backfill Audio:
backfill_audio.tooltip: Fill in audio data for existing entries.

width.label: Width:
width.tooltip: Width of the screenshot in pixels.

height.label: Height:
height.tooltip: Height of the screenshot in pixels.

extension.label: Extension:
extension.tooltip: File extension for the screenshot format.

animated.label: Animated:
animated.tooltip: Enable to create an animated screenshot. Will be a webm file encoded with AV1. All settings under this are not applicable with this ON.

ffmpeg_options.label: FFmpeg Reencode Options:
ffmpeg_options.tooltip: Custom FFmpeg options for re-encoding screenshots.

timing.label: Screenshot Timing:
timing.tooltip: Select when to take the screenshot relative to the line: beginning, middle, or end.

offset.label: Screenshot Offset:
offset.tooltip: Time in seconds to offset the screenshot based on the Timing setting above (should almost always be positive, can be negative if you use "middle")

use_selector.label: Use Screenshot Selector for every card:
use_selector.tooltip: Enable to use the screenshot selector to choose the screenshot point on every card.

hotkey_updates_anki.label: Screenshot Hotkey Updates Anki:
hotkey_updates_anki.tooltip: Enable to allow Screenshot hotkey/button to update the latest anki card.

beginning_offset.label: Audio Extraction Beginning Offset:
beginning_offset.tooltip: Offset in seconds from beginning of the video to extract (Should Usually be negative or 0). If you find that the beginning of your audio is cut off, try decreasing this value.

end_offset.label: Audio Extraction End Offset:
end_offset.tooltip: Offset in seconds to trim from the end before VAD processing starts. Warning: May Result in lost audio if negative.

ffmpeg_preset.label: FFmpeg Preset Options:
ffmpeg_preset.tooltip: Select a preset FFmpeg option for re-encoding screenshots.

ffmpeg_options.label: FFmpeg Reencode Options:
ffmpeg_options.tooltip: Custom FFmpeg options for re-encoding audio files.

anki_media_collection.label: Anki Media Collection:
anki_media_collection.tooltip: Path of the Anki Media Collection, used for external Trimming tool. NO TRAILING SLASH

external_tool.label: External Audio Editing Tool:
external_tool.tooltip: Path to External tool that opens the audio up for manual trimming. I recommend OcenAudio for in-place Editing.

external_tool_enabled.label: Enabled:
external_tool_enabled.tooltip: Send Audio to External Tool for Editing.

open_obs.label: Open OBS:
open_obs.tooltip: Open OBS when the GSM starts.

close_obs.label: Close OBS:
close_obs.tooltip: Close OBS when the GSM closes.

host.label: Host:
host.tooltip: Host address for the OBS WebSocket server.

port.label: Port:
port.tooltip: Port number for the OBS WebSocket server.

password.label: Password:
password.tooltip: Password for the OBS WebSocket server.

game_from_scene.label: Get Game From Scene Name:
game_from_scene.tooltip: Changes Current Game to Scene Name

min_replay_size.label: Minimum Replay Size (KB):
min_replay_size.tooltip: Minimum Replay Size for OBS Replays in KB. If Replay is Under this, Audio/Screenshot Will not be grabbed.

turn_off_replay_buffer_management.label: Turn off Replay Buffer Management:
turn_off_replay_buffer_management.tooltip: Disable OBS Replay Buffer Management. This is useful if you want to manually manage the replay buffer in OBS.

select_profile.label: Select Profile:
select_profile.tooltip: Select a profile to load its settings.

obs_scene.label: OBS Scene (Auto Switch Profile):
obs_scene.tooltip: Select an OBS scene to associate with this profile. (Optional)

switch_to_default.label: Switch To Default If Not Found:
switch_to_default.tooltip: Enable to switch to the default profile if the selected OBS scene is not found.

advanced.title: Advanced
advanced.player_note: Note: Only one of these will take effect, prioritizing audio.

audio_player_path.label: Audio Player Path:
audio_player_path.tooltip: Path to the audio player executable. Will open the trimmed Audio

video_player_path.label: Video Player Path:
video_player_path.tooltip: Path to the video player executable. Will seek to the location of the line in the replay

play_latest_hotkey.label: Play Latest Video/Audio Hotkey:
play_latest_hotkey.tooltip: Hotkey to trim and play the latest audio.

multiline_linebreak.label: Multi-line Line-Break:
multiline_linebreak.tooltip: Line break for multi-line mining. This goes between each sentence

multiline_storage_field.label: Multi-Line Sentence Storage Field:
multiline_storage_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for storing the multi-line sentence temporarily.

ocr_port.label: OCR WebSocket Port:
ocr_port.tooltip: Port for OCR WebSocket communication. GSM will also listen on this port

texthooker_comm_port.label: Texthooker Communication WebSocket Port:
texthooker_comm_port.tooltip: Port for GSM Texthooker WebSocket communication.

plaintext_export_port.label: Plaintext/JL Websocket Export Port:
plaintext_export_port.tooltip: Port that GSM will send plaintext to. Useful for integrating with other tools like JL.

reset_line_hotkey.label: Reset Line Hotkey:
reset_line_hotkey.tooltip: Hotkey to reset the current line of dialogue.

polling_rate.label: Polling Rate:
polling_rate.tooltip: Rate at which Anki will check for updates (in milliseconds).

enabled.label: Add To Anki:
enabled.tooltip: Enable or disable Adding AI Result to Anki.

gemini_model.label: Gemini AI Model:
gemini_model.tooltip: Select the AI model to use.

gemini_api_key.label: Gemini API Key:
gemini_api_key.tooltip: API key for the selected AI provider (Gemini only currently).

groq_model.label: Groq AI Model:
groq_model.tooltip: Select the Groq AI model to use.

groq_api_key.label: Groq API Key:
groq_api_key.tooltip: API key for Groq AI provider.

local_model.label: Local AI Model:
local_model.tooltip: Local AI Model to Use, Only very basic Translation is supported atm. May require some other setup, but idk.

openai_model.label: OpenAI Model:
openai_model.tooltip: Select the OpenAI model to use.

openai_url.label: OpenAI API URL:
openai_url.tooltip: Custom URL for OpenAI API. Leave blank to use the default.

anki_field.label: Anki Field:
anki_field.tooltip: Field in Anki for AI-generated content.

context_length.label: Dialogue Context Length:
context_length.tooltip: Number of previous/next lines to include as context for AI. 0 to disable. -1 for as many as possible (Use With Caution)

use_canned_translation.label: Use Canned Translation Prompt:
use_canned_translation.tooltip: Use a pre-defined translation prompt for AI.

use_canned_context.label: Use Canned Context Prompt:
use_canned_context.tooltip: Use a pre-defined context prompt for AI.

websocket_port.label: Overlay WebSocket Port:
websocket_port.tooltip: Port for the overlay WebSocket communication. Used for experimental overlay features.

overlay_monitor.label: Monitor to Capture:
overlay_monitor.tooltip: Select the monitor to capture (1-based index).

overlay_engine.label: Overlay Engine:
overlay_engine.tooltip: Select the OCR engine for the overlay. If you use lens, and are on windows, it will use OneOCR to optimize the scan.

periodic.label: Periodic Capture:
periodic.tooltip: Enable periodic capture of the screen for Overlay. Note, you still need text flowing into GSM for mining to work.

periodic_interval.label: Capture Interval (Seconds):
periodic_interval.tooltip: Interval in seconds for periodic screen capture.

periodic_ratio.label: Periodic Match Ratio:
periodic_ratio.tooltip: Ratio (0-1) used during periodic scanning to determine how much of the region must match to count as detected. Higher = Less Strict, more Scanning.

number_of_local_scans_per_event.label: Local Scans Per Text Event:
number_of_local_scans_per_event.tooltip: How many local scans to perform per text event (agent, textractor, etc.) before stopping or sending results to the OCR engine. .1s delay between scans for now.

wip.title: WIP
wip.warning_experimental: Warning: These features are experimental and may not work as expected.
wip.warning_overlay_deps: Overlay requires OwOCR dependencies to be installed, and requires an external app to be running.

reset_to_default.title: Reset to Default
reset_to_default.message: Are you sure you want to reset all settings in this tab to default?

select_profile.title: Select Profile
select_profile.message: Multiple profiles match the current scene. Please select the profile:

config_error.title: Configuration Error
config_error.full_auto_and_backfill: Cannot have Full Auto and Backfill mode on at the same time! Note: Backfill is a very niche workflow.
config_error.no_input_method: Cannot have both Clipboard and Websocket Disabled.

delete_profile.title: Confirm Delete
delete_profile.message: Are you sure you want to delete the profile '{profile_name}'?

install_ocenaudio.title: Download OcenAudio?
install_ocenaudio.message: Would you like to download and install OcenAudio? It is a free audio editing software that works extremely well with GSM.
install_ocenaudio.success_message: OcenAudio has been downloaded and installed. You can find it at {path}.

set_anki_media.title: Set Default Anki Media Collection?
set_anki_media.message:
Would you like to set the default Anki media collection path? This will help the script find the media collection for external trimming.

Default: %APPDATA%/Anki2/User 1/collection.media
